intro: Graecobolanthus chelmicus, commonly known as the Chelmic sandburs, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, spiny fruits that aid in seed dispersal. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and succulent, reducing water loss, while its flowers are small and clustered. Graecobolanthus chelmicus plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and is of interest in ecological and botanical studies.
